intro: Melandrium stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Melandrium stenophyllum is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
